alert.note: Alert for Northeastern Crook; Northern Campbell; Southern Campbell; Western Crook; Weston; Wyoming Black Hills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued August 04 at 3:15AM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Localized flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...All of northeastern Wyoming, western South Dakota, and into south-central South Dakota. * WHEN...Through Saturday afternoon, especially Friday afternoon and evening and Saturday from mid-morning through the afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying, poor-drainage, and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Scattered showers and thunderstorms are expected to produce heavy rain across the area through the weekend, especially this afternoon through this evening, and then again on Saturday. Two to four inches of rain, with locally higher amounts, are possible in a short period of time with the stronger thunderstorms. Runoff from this heavy rainfall may lead to flash flooding. Note that most locations will not see this much rainfall, yet the potential still exists. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You are encouraged to monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: Northeastern Crook; Northern Campbell; Southern Campbell; Western Crook; Weston; Wyoming Black Hills
